full_description:
Job Summary
We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Business Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will play a critical role in bridging the gap between business needs and technology solutions by analyzing data, designing processes, and supporting project initiatives. This position offers an exciting opportunity to work with a variety of data tools and methodologies, including Tableau, Power BI, Looker, and ETL processes. The Business Analyst will collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver actionable insights and drive strategic decision-making.
\n
Responsibilities
\n
\n
Gather, analyze, and document business requirements to support project development and process improvements.
\n
Develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Tableau, Power BI, and Looker to communicate key insights effectively.
\n
Support Agile project management methodologies by participating in sprint planning, stand-ups, and retrospectives.
\n
Design and optimize databases using Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, and database design principles to ensure data integrity and efficiency.
\n
Perform data analysis using SQL, R, Python, VBA, Bash (Unix shell), and Talend for data extraction, transformation (ETL), and loading processes.
\n
Collaborate with technical teams on SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) activities to ensure successful project delivery.
\n
Conduct business analysis activities including process modeling with Visio and defining data requirements for linked data initiatives.
\n
Assist in project management tasks such as timeline tracking, risk assessment, and stakeholder communication.
\n
Stay current with industry trends in analytics tools and techniques to recommend innovative solutions for business challenges.
\n
\n
Experience
\n
\n
Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role with a strong understanding of data analysis skills.
\n
Hands-on experience with Tableau, Power BI, Looker, or other visualization tools.
\n
Familiarity with Agile methodologies and project management practices.
\n
Strong knowledge of SDLC processes for software development projects.
\n
Proficiency in SQL Server, Oracle databases, and database design principles.
\n
Experience working with ETL tools such as Talend or similar platforms.
\n
Programming skills in R, Python, VBA, Bash (Unix shell) are highly desirable.
\n
Knowledge of Linked Data concepts and analytics techniques is a plus.
\n
Excellent analysis skills combined with the ability to communicate complex findings clearly to stakeholders. This role is ideal for candidates passionate about leveraging data analytics to influence business decisions while working within a dynamic team environment that values innovation and continuous learning.
\n
\n
Job Type: Full-time
\n
Pay: $84,591.26 - $101,873.34 per year
\n
Benefits:
\n
\n
401(k)
\n
Dental insurance
\n
Health insurance
\n
Paid holidays
\n
Paid time off
\n
Tuition reimbursement
\n
\n
Work Location: In person
